Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Individualized Ventilation in Frail Patients Undergoing Non-Cardiac Surgery

Trial_Design.evidence: In this prospective, randomized controlled trial, 61 frail patients aged ≥65 years undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery at the First People’s Hospital of Xiangshan County were enrolled between January and December 2024.

Participants.evidence: 61 frail patients aged ≥65 years undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery at the First People’s Hospital of Xiangshan County

Intervention.evidence: Participants were randomized to either the individualized PEEP group (n=31) or the standard PEEP group (n=30).

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to compare the effects of driving pressure-guided individualized ventilation versus standard positive end-expiratory pressure (PEEP) ventilation on PPCs in frail patients undergoing non-cardiac surgery.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the incidence of PPCs within 7 days postoperatively.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomization was performed using a pre-established allocation list

Blinding.evidence: outcome assessors were blinded to group assignments

Number_Randomised.evidence: 61 frail patients aged ≥65 years undergoing elective non-cardiac surgery at the First People’s Hospital of Xiangshan County were enrolled between January and December 2024.

Number_Analysed.evidence: Participants were randomized to either the individualized PEEP group (n=31) or the standard PEEP group (n=30).

Result_Outcome.evidence: No PPCs occurred in the individualized PEEP group, while 7 patients (23.3%) in the standard PEEP group developed PPCs (p<0.01).
